meta.name: generator
meta.content: HTML Tidy for Windows (vers 25 March 2009), see www.w3.org

div.p: JMeter, from the Apache Software Foundation, is a Java application designed to load test functional behavior and measure performance. It was originally designed for testing Web Applications but has since expanded to other test functions.
More information can be found at JMeter.
@PLUGIN_KEY@ plugin calls the JMeter tool via command line and passes the user-provided parameters.
@PLUGIN_KEY@ plugin includes the most important features provided by the JMeter tool, also allows some extra funcionality to make the test more configurable according to specific needs.

ElectricFlow itself provides some advantages like parameters checking, easy functionality selection using only check boxes or radio buttons, hitorical log reports, procedure duration statistics, simple credentials attachment, real time analysis of the log been generated, among others.
This plugin was developed and tested against JMeter version 2.4.
IMPORTANT: In the ElectricFlow UI, from the Home page, open the Main Menu, and click Admin > Plugins to open the Plugin Manager.
IMPORTANT: For all parameter descriptions below, required parameters are shown in bold italics.

This procedure allows the input of all necessary parameters along with some extra of them to make the test more configurable. When the parameters are defined the JMeter test command is created and run into ElectricFlow, displaying at the end the result(s) of it. It displays a summary, which shows the date and time when the step started and finished. It also creates a log file, which contains the output generated by the console.

tr.td: Indicate the directory where the jmx test file resides. (Required)
Provide the name of the jmx test file to execute. (This is the command-line '-t ' option) (Required)
Provide the name of the remote server where the jmx file resides. (This is the command-line '-l ' option)
Provide the name of the file for the test results. (This is the command-line '-R' option)
Provide any additional options to add to the jmeter command.

ul.li: Procedure name(s) were changed in the step picker section
Changed properties to make parameters display properly
Improvement on the values that can be enter on the workingdirectory field
